{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amniotic fluid is the protective liquid contained by the amniotic sac of a gravid amniote. It is generated from maternal plasma, and passes through the fetal membranes by osmotic and hydrostatic forces. When fetal kidneys begin to function around week 16, fetal urine also contributes to the fluid. This information suggests that the fetus is the main producer of amniotic fluid.", "answer_choice": "B. Fetus"}
